Description: In the first presentation there will be a focus on the role of UPR-PERK responsive micro-RNAs and how they influence cell fate decisions. The second presentation will discuss the mechanisms of ER quality control and how they are modulated in cancer. Specifically, the targeting of protein disulfide isomerases is emerging as a novel strategy to treat cancers with developed secretory capacity. The third and final presentation will address stress-elicited modulation of ATF4 and the type I interferon pathways, their impact upon cell adaptation and the tumoricidal activity of the cytotoxic T lymphocytes. The roles of described mechanisms in anti-tumor immune responses and efficacy of adoptive transfer CAR T cell immunotherapies will be discussed.
